title: La construction des prix à la SNCF, une socio-histoire de la tarification

last_post.content: "De la péréquation au yield management" https://www.cairn.info/revue-francaise-de-sociologie-2014-1-page-5.htm "La SNCF met en place au tournant des années 1980-1990 un système de tarification différentielle en temps réel appelé yield management. L’objectif d’un tel dispositif est de fixer les prix en fonction de la propension des voyageurs à payer pour circuler sur le réseau. Sous une forme complexifiée, c’est ce modèle tarifaire qui prévaut encore aujourd’hui en France pour le transport « grandes lignes »"

title: The steep cost of capture | Interactions

last_post.content:
TLRD, great AI capture is getting attention! But to address it, we need to tackle the political econ of tech, grapple w the term "AI" (& who gets to define/apply it), & recognize that extending access to BigTech infra/data entrenches the power dynamics at the root of the problem.

For those interested, here is the paper that lays this argument out in more detail: https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3488666

title: Revisiting the Transit Timing and Atmosphere Characterization of the Neptune-mass Planet HAT-P-26 b

last_post.content: The other paper pushed out this week is here: https://arxiv.org/abs/2303.03610. it's led by my SPEARNET colleague, Napaporn A-thano. She has modeled the transmission spectrum of another exoplanet, Hat-P-26b. She's also used the data to look for possible evidence of any other planets in the system that may be gravitationally tugging on Hat-P-26b. (14/n)

Uvalde District Attorney Fights Release of Public Records Against Wishes of Most Families
--
Uvalde’s DA has joined the TX Dept of Public Safety in fighting the release of public records related to the mass shooting at Robb Elementary, arguing that all of the families who lost children want them withheld.

But attorneys for a vast majority of the families are refuting that claim, saying that the information should be made public.

title: Sorry AI, APIs Are for Humans

last_post.content:
Will #AI replace #API designers? 'No, in the same way, auto-generating an API from a data model has never become a serious development option: successful API design that aspires to be more than point-to-point integrations requires intuition, stakeholder engagement, and creative synthesis. While the current LLM crop is another input source, they lack the "human touch" we associate with good design. After all, as counter-intuitive as it may seem, we build APIs for humans.'

https://netapinotes.substack.com/p/sorry-ai-apis-are-for-humans

So excited to share my work from the last 3 years 🥳🎉🥳

We developed a new method to analyze multi-condition single-cell data and find differential expression neighborhoods for arbitrary exp. designs.

All the details (and some cool diff. geometry) at https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.03.06.531268v1

We also implemented an R package https://github.com/const-ae/lemur

It's still in beta, so please try it out and let me know if something doesn't work or if there is a feature you would like to see :)

So excited to share my work from the last 3 years 🥳🎉🥳

We developed a new method to analyze multi-condition single-cell data and find differential expression neighborhoods for arbitrary exp. designs.

All the details (and some cool diff. geometry) at https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.03.06.531268v1

We also implemented an R package https://github.com/const-ae/lemur

It's still in beta, so please try it out and let me know if something doesn't work or if there is a feature you would like to see :)

title: Visualizing critical disaster data with ReadyMapper | Stamen

last_post.content: New post: "Visualizing critical disaster data with ReadyMapper"! We worked w/ #CrisisReady & #DirectRelief to create an interactive map & reporting tool that visualizes critical time-sensitive data during natural #disasters. #ReadyMapper brings together over a dozen datasets & pipelines to synthesize real-time population movement, vulnerability, & healthcare infrastructure to aid #emergency planning officials in times of crisis. Read more: https://stamen.com/visualizing-critical-disaster-data-with-readymapper/ #dataviz #maps cc @aschroeder

title: Hospital’s water purification system stripped out chlorine, killing 3 patients

title: GitHub - coleifer/sqlite-vtfunc: Implement SQLite table-valued functions with Python

last_post.content:
@erlendaasland do you have an idea for how hard it would be to add support for custom table-valued functions written in Python to sqlite3?

There's a third-party module for those in https://github.com/coleifer/sqlite-vtfunc - but it would be really great if that functionality made it into the sqlite3 package in the standard library some day!

I just discovered this very clearly written paper, "Probability and metaphysics" (2018) by Peter Lukan from the university of Ljubljana. As he points out, hardly anyone writes about this stuff. It mostly focuses on Popper and Suppes, writing that is long overdue a dusting off and a modern investigation. Check it out, ye philosophically minded people. https://hrcak.srce.hr/file/313401
